citation.article-title: New insight into diversity in the genus Xenorhabdus, including the description of ten novel species
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Xenorhabdus miraniensis sp. nov.
Xenorhabdus miraniensis (mi.ra.ni.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. miraniensis from Mirani, a small town in Australia, the source of the nematode from which the type strain was isolated).
The upper temperature limiting growth in LB broth is 38 °C.
Has no DNase activity and assimilates Simmons' citrate and many carbohydrates, including d-malate, lactate, d-glucosamine, l-aspartate and l-tyrosine.

The type strain is symbiotically associated with an as-yet-undescribed nematode of the Steinernematidae (Akhurst & Boemare, 1988) isolated at Mirani in Queensland (Australia) and has not yet been found elsewhere.
The type strain is strain Q1T (=CIP 109069T=DSM 17902T).
The GenBank accession number of the 16S rRNA gene sequence of the type strain is DQ211713.
